wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-Commander George Josslyn L'Estrange Howard, 11th Earl of Carlisle (6 January 1895 – 17 February 1963), styled Viscount Morpeth from 1911 to 1912, was a British nobleman, politician, and peer.

response: * George Howard, 11th Earl of Carlisle (1895–1963), British peer

link_mentions.page: Bridget Monckton, 11th Lady Ruthven of Freeland
response: On 17 January 1918 she married George Howard, 11th Earl of Carlisle, becoming the Countess of Carlisle. They had two children:

link_mentions.page: George Josslyn L'Estrange Howard, 11th Earl of Carlisle

response: Lord Carlisle was the son of George Howard, 11th Earl of Carlisle and Bridget Monckton, 11th Lady Ruthven of Freeland. He was educated at Eton College. He succeeded his father in the earldom in 1963 and his mother in the lordship of Ruthven of Freeland in 1982.Charles James Ruthven Howard, 12th Earl of Carlisle profile, thepeerage.com; accessed 2 April 2016.

link_mentions.page: Walter Hore-Ruthven, 10th Lord Ruthven of Freeland
response: * Bridget Helen Hore-Ruthven, 11th Lady Ruthven of Freeland (1896–1982); married George Howard, 11th Earl of Carlisle (divorced), had issue, later remarried Walter Monckton, 1st Viscount Monckton of Brenchley
